sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An epitaph vpon the death of the right honorable Edward Earle of Darby, Lorde Stanly and Strange of Knocking, Lord and Gouernour of the Isles of Man, Knight of the noble order of the Garter, and one of the Queenes Maiesties most honorable priuie Counsell Deceased the. xxiiij. of Nouem. 1572. Denton, John.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
By VV. VVilliamson, dvvelling in Distaffe Lane, Imprinted at London : [1572]
Signed: Iohn Denton minist. Verse - "Shall shaking hande with drilling teares, deliuer rural verse?". Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
An epitaph vpon the death of the right honorable Edward Earle of Darby, Lorde Stanly and Strange of Knocking, Lord and Gouernour of the Isles of Man, Knight of the noble order of the Garter, and one of the Queenes Maiesties most honorable priuie Counsell Deceased the. xxiiij. of Nouem. 1572. Denton, John.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
By VV. VVilliamson, dvvelling in Distaffe Lane, Imprinted at London : [1572]
Signed: Iohn Denton minist. Verse - "Shall shaking hande with drilling teares, deliuer rural verse?". Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
VV. VVilliamson
Distaffe Lane
>>>>>>> imprintparse
